snippet: The court agreed with a conservative organization that the inquiry into spending by such groups in recall elections in 2012, including that of Gov. Scott Walker, hurt its ability to participate in elections and to conduct fund-raising.
abstract: Federal Judge Rudolph T Randa orders officials to cease investigation into political spending by conservative groups in 2012 recall elections in Wisconsin, including that of Gov Scott Walker; if ruling stands, it could end years of secrecy over investigations involving Walker by freeing those involved to divulge details.

byline.original: By EMMA G. FITZSIMMONS and MONICA DAVEY

lead_paragraph: The court agreed with a conservative organization that the inquiry into spending by such groups in recall elections in 2012, including that of Gov. Scott Walker, hurt its ability to participate in elections and to conduct fund-raising.

headline.main: Judge Halts Investigation of Political Spending in Wisconsin
headline.print_headline: Judge Halts Investigation of Spending in Wisconsin
